as a jr data analyst you'll report to a services manager and work on the customer value and services team. your main goal is to partner with our customer success teams to analyze their walkme customers' engagement data and create reports that express that value to clients across all customer segments. your performance will depend on your ability to manage a queue of customer-facing bi requests while collaborating with account managers and digital adoption consultants to measure and present value.

integrate information from many data sources to design custom reports for our clients’ needs.

design and architect visually appealing dashboards that are easily consumed.
write queries and perform ad hoc data analysis to understand trends in walkme engagement and health performance.
develop new metrics to identify trends in new product applications.
contribute to the development of the business intelligence team through tools, skills, and culture
what you'll need to succeed
bachelors degree
passion towards data manipulation, visualization, and presentation.
strong work-ethic and proactive in delivering results in challenging situations.
willingness to learn and open-mindedness.
bachelor’s degree in economics, math, statistics or quantitative field.
mastery of sql; tableau or gooddata experience a plus or other data analysis software.
team player – you will join forces with several of walkme's other teams daily working towards the right solution with an appreciation for a high bar.
what you'll love about us!
full health coverage for employees, walkme pays 100% of employee premiums and 50% of family premiums and has a generous vacation policy to encourage a healthy work-life balance.
weekly themed happy hours every friday and catered lunch to promote community within a casual office environment.

5.title: Data and Reporting Analyst I/II
5.posting:
brown & toland physician services organization

job description

job title:reporting and data analyst i

reports to: director, research, planning & analysisflsa status: exempt

date revised:june 2019

primary purpose:
as part of the reporting and analysis department of brown & toland, performs quantitative and qualitative analysis of healthcare and financial data. the data analyst acts as an internal consultant to the organization; developing reporting solutions, analytic methodologies, data presentation and analysis of data for assigned customers.
responsibilities include the process of business needs collection and documentation; data and systems analysis; report design and creation; data findings formatting, aggregation and presentation; results analysis; and documentation of processes and findings, to cover the reporting business needs of assigned clients.
supervision:

position does not have supervisory responsibilities.

key functions related to performance evaluation

data sources and tools:
understands and is able to use at least some of types of company data (health care, claims, patient, eligibility, bar, etc.).
knowledge of company’s data sources (e.g. dw, datamart, cognos 10 data packages and cubes) and tools (e.g. cognos 10 report studio, microsoft access). chooses the most appropriate form of report delivery; assuring best quality, transparency of process and maximizes reusability as possible;
works with it and with other analysts to request or propose changes or improvements, in data warehouse and cognos packages that facilitate the production of data, analysis or reports.

project design and presentation: work with customers and with other team member(s) to:
determine desired goal(s) and data needs of new projects; operational reports; and ad-hoc requests. helps clients clarify their needs and the business need of the report or other deliverable;
use knowledge of data and systems and to proactively contribute to report design process;
use available tools to summarize data and present final analysis (e.g. written summaries, charts), and
document the report process and logic in a manner consistent with the scope of the project.
might be assigned to work under leadership from other decision support analysts, depending on the project.

analysis
validate and analyze both internally and externally generated data;
perform data analysis on specific reports of data sets, find trends, communicates findings with requestors.
use preliminary analyses to revise report methodologies when necessary, as well as analyzing end results.
uses primary data sources (e.g. idx) for data validation and might use and analysis tools (e.g. cognos, excel, spss) to deliver statistical results, pivot tables, trends, etc.
provide high-level reviews of other analyst’s final reports.
works closely with other data analysts to assure common practices, validation and documentation are followed.

major duties and responsibilities:
(e = essential; d = desirable)

conduct regular meetings with assigned clients to discuss analytic and data needs, plan upcoming reporting cycle, and solicit feedback on completed projects (e)
design and complete reports and data analysis projects including defining data needs and appropriate methodologies and report formats (e)
perform quantitative analysis, evaluate results, and report on findings individually or as part of an integrated team (e)
provide written and graphical reports with accompanying documentation on findings (e)
document all reports, analyses, and program responsibilities (e)
produce and maintain valid and reliable standardized reports to support customer’s efforts to manage patient care activities (e)
perform qa of work performed by self and others, including validating accuracy of underlying data by verifying with primary source (e.g., idx, cactus), and double-checking methodology of colleagues’ analyses (e)
identify and pursue opportunities to automate regular reporting, including transitioning reports to new bi tools as well as proposing and helping design, and suggesting improvements to existing solutions (d)
works with other analysts to assure that solutions are not isolated but to leverage as possible from other initiatives. actively participates in team solution discussions to improve processes and standardize solutions (e)
assist in tool and data training and education of other analysts (d)
serve as back-up to other analysts, taking on overflow projects and attending meetings when necessary and feasible (e)
 perform other duties as assigned (e)

requirements:

education and/or training:
bachelor's degree in a work-related field/discipline from an accredited college or university or equivalent is desired. course work in systems analysis, computer science, sql, statistics, databases or other related areas preferred.

skills and abilities:
strong quantitative and analytic skills; attention to detail.
proficiency in spreadsheet, database, and business intelligence or analytics tool business analytical skills to understand verbalize and document the business objectives of his/her customer and to develop the reporting and analytical solutions to the business issues.
well developed written and verbal communication skills.
ability to work independently and as part of the team.

experience:
one year of directly related work experience including previous experience creating variety of reports using a business intelligence or analytics tool , access or excel; performing quantitative analysis, health care statistical or financial analysis.
experience using relational databases, data warehouse and datamarts to create reporting solutions. basic sql skills, able to read and interpret sequel statements.
experience using relational databases, to create reports solutions.
understanding of database schemas in especial dimensional systems. able to work with database developers and architects to improve data sources.
health data knowledge or interest preferred.
prefer experience working with other business groups; document requirements, performing data validation or creating technical documentation

complies with policies and procedures, equipment orientation and workspace set up to ensure personal safety and well being as it relates to ergonomically sound usage, reporting immediately to management any complications or difficulties regarding appropriate usage of workplace and equipment.

this position is seeking an individual to merge various clincal and claims datasets, conduct data cleaning, and prepare the dataset for statistical analysis. the data analyst will conduct quality check, evaluate missing data, and generate descriptive statistics. furthermore, the analyst will communicate data quality and discuss data issues with other researchers. ideally the analyst will generate and utilize graphs and figures to communicate data structure and data results.

please note: this is a part time contract position ending on july 31, 2019.

institute for health & aging
the institute for health & aging (iha) is the university of california's first campus-wide organized research unit (oru) devoted to the study of health and aging and is the only oru in the school of nursing (son) at ucsf. dr. wendy max has served as director of iha since june 2013. since being established in 1985, iha has been successful in obtaining $326 million extramural funding and establishing partnerships and collaborations within the university as well as with external groups, particularly with the state of california department of public health (cdph). our research has had an impact in the broad areas of aging and health and in the health policy arena.

the university of california, san francisco (ucsf) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. it is the only campus in the 10-campus uc system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

10.title: Products Data Analyst
10.posting:
join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. we are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. at splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. learn more about splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
role:
splunk is rapidly growing its internal product analytics capabilities and is seeking a data scientist to provide operational metrics and analysis around product usage. in this role, you will enable product owners to make effective, data driven, and strategic decisions around how to improve our products, what features to prioritize, and how to maximize value. you will work with the ux team to interpret product usage patterns and recommend workflow improvements. the short term reporting requirements will help define a longer term product analytics roadmap.
you will ask the right questions about the data – what data is collected, where does it live, and how it can best be utilized to measure product objectives. you purposefully address data quality issues and look for opportunities to align both data and metrics collected/used across our product line. you will partner with product leadership to translate business semantics into rigorous math and implement reporting using multiple tools.
this is a full-time position based in either our san francisco or santana row office.
responsibilities:
you will build reports and dashboards for product leadership on product usage, uptake, engagement
you will build out data pipelines as necessary for analysis
you will work with product owners to obtain quantitative evidence for products and features
you will develop quantitative metrics and analytical support for measuring product and data quality
you will collaborate with ux researchers and designers to analyze validate product engagement and usage
you will document, interpret and consult on analytics performed against product-generated data
you will design, build and maintain a data dictionary with standardized metrics, how to compute them and what data to use
you will provide ad hoc reporting and analysis upon request for abstract and strategic data questions
requirements:
superb interpersonal and communication skills
strong analytical problem-solving skills
highly collaborative team spirit
ability to explore open-ended questions and present compelling arguments using data
experience applying statistical techniques to answer real questions on real world data is a plus
proficiency using excel and sql and visualization tools such as tableau
experience building searches/dashboards in splunk is highly desired
mba or bachelors degree in an analytical field (e.g. data science, computer science, operational engineering).
2 + years experience in a quantitative or analytics role preferred

financial analysts ensure that google makes sound financial decisions. as a data analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to take on big picture challenges.

26.title: Research Data Analyst
26.posting:
the research data analyst will join a collaborative and exciting team of researchers at the f.i. proctor foundation studying prevention of child mortality in west africa. researchers at the f.i. proctor foundation conduct randomized controlled trials and large epidemiological studies on ocular diseases that can cause blindness and child health. the epidemiological studies involve large administrative databases and the trials involve domestic and international collaboration.

this position requires an employee with excellent communication and organizational skills who can be relied upon to play an integral role in implementing research studies (including international trials). the individual will be asked to contribute to study design from a methodological standpoint, help with database creation, management and analysis, as well as to assist in the writing of grants, progress reports, and manuscripts. responsibilities will also include communication with and coordination of collaborating sites, training investigators and study personnel, and being responsible for regulatory approvals. travel to study sites will also be required for study implementation and monitoring.

the employee should show a strong interest in clinical research and a desire to contribute to the state of knowledge on the prevention, treatment and correlates of disease. the individual must be able to multi-task, problem-solve, and apply creative solutions to new and unexpected situations at first with substantial supervision but gradually with more limited supervision.

proctor foundation for research in ophthalmology
the f.i. proctor foundation for research in ophthalmology at ucsf is committed to engaging in research activities and providing state-of-art patient care that address infectious and inflammatory disease that cause blindness. the mission is the prevention of blindness worldwide through research and teaching focused on infectious and inflammatory eye disease.

about ucsf

the university of california, san francisco (ucsf) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences, health professions and excellence in patient care. it is the only campus in the 10-campus uc system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

28.title: Data Analyst

quantcast is hiring a data analyst to work on our analytics team in our san francisco or new york office.

we have created one of the world's largest, living data-sets and we use it to bring unparalleled relevance to online advertising. by utilizing technology and big data to understand digital audiences, quantcast solves the biggest challenges in marketing.

as a data analyst, you will handle a large volume of custom requests daily related to our advertising campaigns. you think creatively and enjoy discovering new and innovative ways to analyze and present data. you bias towards action, efficiency, and automation, as well as possess the intellectual curiosity to challenge current products and processes. in addition, you work quickly and accurately and are a self starter.
responsibilities:

quantcast owns and operates the world’s largest audience insights and measurement platform on the open internet. fueled by live data drawn from more than 100 million web and mobile destinations, quantcast applies machine learning technology to help marketers, publishers, and agencies grow their brands by better understanding and predicting consumer interactions in real-time.

the climate corporation’s mission is to help the world’s farmers sustainably increase their productivity with digital tools. the data and analytics team is focused on creating competitive advantage for climate and our customers through novel data infrastructure, metrics, insights and data services. we are a small but rapidly growing analysis and engineering team that builds and leverages state-of-the-art analytics systems. our work informs decisions and direction for our business, while also impacting our products.
data analysts are part of a core team that drives strategic decision making throughout the company. as a member of the team, your primary responsibility will be to work with department leaders to derive insights that improve business performance. this includes exploratory analysis of large data sets, metrics identification and report creation, and development and maintenance of analytic systems. this role will broadly influence the company’s products, operational effectiveness, sales/marketing strategy, and elevate the role of data as an asset to the business. we are looking for a candidate with a passion for data analysis.

partner with other departments to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities

build reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor the performance of our company
develop new insights and analyses that inform decisions and help us continue to delight the people using our platform

data mining, statistical analysis, and data visualization to help understand how growers are interacting with our fieldview product

familiarity with data science tools like r, python, sql
experience solving analytical problems and presenting findings.

development experience with bi platforms like looker, tableau, periscopedata

passion for data analysis.
excellent communication and collaborative skills.

our teams are composed of industry experts, top scientists, and talented engineers. the environment is extremely engaging and fast-paced, with dozens of specialties coming together to provide the best possible products and experiences for our customers.

about us

we launched our flagship product, an add-to-calendar button, in 2014 with the mission to take calendar beyond just work by connecting people with meaningful experiences: sporting events, concerts, broadway shows, yoga classes, whatever floats your boat.

for most of us, our calendar is how we stay organized: it's mobile and ensures you're ready and on time for life's most important events. calendar apps are the second-most used only behind email but that's mostly as a utility product. chances are your calendar is just like ours - packed to the brim with all the things you need to do. but what about making time for the things you want to do? that's where we come in. what if you could find all of life's fun experiences inside your calendar?

a big part of fulfilling this vision is working with event creators of all sizes to give them powerful tools to share their events with their communities. you probably first heard about stanza by subscribing to a popular event creator's schedule.

human resources
at sephora, our people create and drive our success. we know that bringing the best beauty products, services, tools, and experiences to our clients means finding, training, and engaging the absolute best talent in the industry. our hr teams invest heavily in our talent, both at our corporate headquarters and in sephora stores. we strongly believe (and our actions prove it!) that our people are our best asset, and we work every day to arm them with the knowledge and tools not just to get the job done, but to feel inspired and fearless while doing it.

64.title: Data Analyst
64.posting:
as a leading mobile games developer, jam city is looking to “level up” our talent. we’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

perks & benefits
unlimited vacation, paid sick days & holidays
100% employee covered medical, dental, vision plan base plan
life insurance, 401k, flexible spending accounts, commuter benefits & more
catered lunches & well-stocked kitchens
onsite gym & wellness activities (yoga & zumba)
happy hours
company events
dog friendly

about us
we are a small, dynamic, team of data analysts working primarily with games within the sf jam city studio. we are responsible for providing accurate and up-to-date analysis to game teams, the studio and executives. we work directly with all aspects of the game teams - interacting with engineers, product managers and designers to empower them to make data driven decisions to enable them to meet short and long term goals. we are continually focused on improving analytic approaches, predictive modeling and longer term projects to enhance player experience and improve the company’s bottom line. we collaborate extensively with the jam city data science, analytics and platform teams - on projects ranging from machine learning to pipeline improvements to visualization.


about the role
are you interested in using data to help drive product decisions? do you want your work to directly influence the experience of over millions of people playing our games on a daily basis? do you like to automate the tedious stuff so you can spend more time using machine learning to optimize product performance? do you enjoy learning new skills? do you enjoy working with different disciplines? are you excited by clean data?

we are looking for passionate & proactive data analyst to join our team! you will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the gaming industry's top professionals, touching on large amounts of data, and helping our teams make quick & impactful changes to our games.
responsibilities
work with product managers and designers to design and validate analytics tracking in game to ensure accuracy of and depth of reporting.
work with product managers and designers to provide analysis of player behavior and overall game performance using our top of the line data warehouse.
create easily interpretable live dashboards to allow for rapid analysis of product health, feature prioritization, event performance and monetization.
identify and drive analytics projects (data science, visualization, pipeline improvements, data democratization, ab test analysis, etc.) that you want to work on that will provide positive roi for the studio and company. you will have ownership and responsibility for the projects you are working on.
collaborate on machine learning/other data science projects with other data scientists/analysts company wide to improve monetization and engagement.
help design and analyze ab tests to test hypotheses in game.
qualifications
you should be passionate and self-driven with the ability and desire to learn quickly.
b.a. or b.s. in a quantitative field is ideal but if you have strong analytics chops then we’re interested in talking to you.
ideally 3+ years in an analyst/data scientist role at a mobile gaming company, or similar experience.
knowledge of statistics and statistical models (linear/logistic regression, cluster, factor analysis).
experience in analytics tagging/tracking in order to gather the relevant information needed to analyze a product and new features.
expert knowledge of sql, excel and data visualization tools such as tableau.
strong communication skills to articulate quantitative analysis in a way that broad game teams and executives can understand.
because you are interacting with game teams every day, it is critical that you have an interest in and an understanding of how games work, what makes them fun etc.
any experience using python, r, scala, bigquery, databricks, bayesian statistics, machine learning a plus.
about jam city
jam city is a leader in mobile entertainment, providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to broad global audiences.

jam city was founded in 2009 by myspace co-founder and ceo chris dewolfe and former 20th century fox executive josh yguado.

jam city is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest grossing and most enduring social gaming franchises for mobile, including cookie jam (facebook “game of the year” winner) and panda pop.

jam city is the go-to studio for hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands including harry potter, family guy, and marvel avengers. jam city has eight studios around the globe including los angeles (hq), burbank, san francisco, san diego, toronto, bogotá, berlin, and buenos aires.

the jam city team is known for its creative excellence and technological innovation in key areas including storytelling, data science, and audience insights.

70.title: Management Analyst (Data Analytics)
70.company name: Superior Court of California, County of Alameda
70.posting:
job description
the superior court of california, county of alameda is accepting applications for the position of management analyst. under direction, the management analyst performs qualitative and quantitative analysis and prepares related recommendations, reports, and presentations in support of court policy, operations, programs and initiatives.

this recruitment will remain open and the court will accept applications continuously. please be aware that this recruitment may be closed at any time should the court receive a sufficient number of qualified applicants. the court will be reviewing applicants as they come in. subsequent reviews of applicants and interviews will be held on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

for the finance & facilities division:
this position is assigned to the data analytics unit, which is responsible for statistical reporting and analysis of filings, dispositions, and other case and court activity, both internally, for judicial officers and court leadership, and externally, to the judicial council, justice partners, and funders. data analytics staff monitor developments with and the local implications of statewide judicial officer and court staff workload and funding allocation models. the data analytics unit also provides data in response to requests for information from the press and the public, and supports other units in the finance and facilities division with analytical needs, including semi-annual revenue projections. although housed in the finance & facilities division, the data analytics unit works primarily with non-financial data; accounting and budgeting functions are handled by other units.

the current job vacancy is assigned to the finance and facilities division at the rené c. davidson courthouse in oakland.
examples of duties
duties may include but are not limited to the following:
1. defines problems; collects data, conducts analytical studies and administrative, operational and policy research; provides analysis, options and recommendations for executive level decision-making; assists in implementing selected options and recommendations; and assesses effectiveness of new programs, policies and procedures.
2. identifies gaps in existing policies and procedures, identifies opportunities for improving the efficiency of business processes, and develops policies and procedures to meet those needs in assigned areas of responsibility; assists with the implementation of new programs, policies and procedures.
3. develops and monitors program, unit, or division budgets.
4. conducts data collection and analysis and prepares ad hoc and periodic statistical and written reports required by the court, the state and other governmental entities.
5. serves as a liaison to justice system partners, representatives of state and local governmental and non-governmental organizations.
6. maintains a knowledge-base of research on court operations best practices and tracks and analyzes proposed legislative bills, administrative rules, and regulations as related to assigned areas of specialization. assists in training and educating staff and court partners on research and legislation as needed.
7. represents the division at meetings; attends policy and operational meetings and presents data to assist managers in making operational and administrative decisions; facilitates meetings; identifies, prioritizes, distributes and manages action items for a team.
8. drafts and negotiates contracts to provide needed services and prepares grant applications; manages contracts; and assists in creating sustainability strategies for existing grant-funded programs.
9. redesigns and improves forms and public notices; and coordinates publication and dissemination of such materials; responds to verbal and written public inquiries and surveys.
10. supervises staff, independent contractors and consultants as required.
11. performs other related duties as assigned.
minimum qualifications
education:
possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university. possession of a master's degree from an accredited college or university is desirable but not required.

and

experience:
the equivalent to two years of full-time work experience in court, government or other policy, budget or data analysis to include experience developing recommendations based on analyses conducted.

desirable qualifications (finance and facilities placement):
experience with stata, r, sas, spss, or other statistical software
experience with data visualization software such as power bi or tableau
knowledge of the principles and methods of statistics and quantitative social science research
knowledge of visual design principles

substitution::
additional qualifying work experience as described above may substitute for the required education on a year-for-year basis. one year (2000 hours) of additional qualifying work experience will be considered equivalent to 30 semester units/45 quarter units.

physical demands:
physical demands include walking, standing, sitting and climbing up and down stairs; strength, dexterity, coordination and vision to use a keyboard and video display terminal; hearing, listening and speaking to communicate with the public and court staff; dexterity and coordination to handle files and single pieces of paper; occasional lifting of objects weighing up to 25 lbs. such as files, stacks of papers, reference and other materials; moving from place to place within an office or other court location; and reaching for items above and below desk level.

working conditions:
video display terminal is used on a daily basis. attend meetings, respond to emails, and engage in work as needed outside of normal business hours. work occasional evening and weekend hours. travel may be required.
knowledge and abilities
knowledge of principles and practices of court administration, organization, functions, services and management, including evidence-based practices, budget development and management, staff development and training; principles of program evaluation; principles and practices of business and public administration and organizational development; principles, practices and political implications of decisions on budgeting, fiscal management, personnel and contract management; methods of work planning, staffing analysis and project management; data collection and analytical techniques; microsoft office and other software systems; and methods and techniques of organizing work.
ability to write in a detailed, clear, professional and timely style; administer projects and operations consistent with policies and goals; assist in selecting and training staff; promote and model positive office morale and esprit de corps; plan, organize, coordinate and evaluate programs and staff; work under the pressure of deadlines, conflicting demands and emergencies; establish and maintain working relationships with all levels of court staff, elective and appointive bodies, and members of the general public; understand, interpret and apply laws, rules and regulations; communicate in writing on matters related to division policies, funding and operations; prepare and evaluate a variety of narrative and statistical data and reports; revise and adapt procedures to changing needs; plan and implement training programs; analyze problems and identify solutions; write and gain approval for grant proposals; maintain confidential information when required by legal or ethical standards; facilitate meetings; analyze problems and complaints, and identify solutions; work effectively with staff, partners and clients from diverse backgrounds, including socioeconomic, cultural, ethnic, religious, and sexual orientation.

general information
this is a full-time, unrepresented and flsa exempt management position. this position includes a one-year probationary period.

the recruitment and examination process will include the following three components:
a screening of all application materials received including completed application and supplemental questionnaire. a resume does not substitute for completing the application. an incomplete or partial application or supplemental questionnaire will result in disqualification.
a review of the completed application and supplemental questionnaire to select the best-qualified candidates for the oral panel interview process.
an oral interview that will be weighted as 100% of the candidate's final score. the oral interview may contain situational exercises.

the court reserves the right to change the components of the examination process and may limit the number of candidates invited to the oral interview process to include only the best-qualified candidates should there be a large applicant pool.

a properly completed application and supplemental questionnaire must be submitted. the application and supplemental questionnaire are used to evaluate the qualifications. failure to submit the application and/or supplemental questionnaire will result in disqualification.

business operations at youtube spans many functions such as partner management and agreement origination, trust and safety, creator and viewer support, and technical support. youtube insights, infrastructure, and tools (iit) builds the tools and infrastructure that powers these activities effectively and efficiently. our work includes crm solutions, support workflow tooling, and the data infrastructure that make those tools possible. beyond tooling, our insights team provides careful analytical support for the business teams, including performance and impact measurement and data-driven business recommendations.

the revel team is focused on its mission to disrupt and modernize the state of commerce by providing businesses of every size the tools necessary to thrive. come join a smart, motivated team and work at a leading technology company during the next phase of growth.

the role

the sales operations analyst is responsible for helping us align and improve the way sales and marketing work together across the company, with an emphasis on leveraging our crm (salesforce) and marketing automation platform (marketo). additional responsibilities include supporting sales processes, creating bookings reports for executives and providing insights to sales leadership as well as owning our sales reporting tools. this will be a highly visible role that requires someone who can build strong cross-departmental relationships, understand business requirements, and effectively deliver results to our internal stakeholders.

support revenue generating functions by driving full-funnel performance by interfacing the demand generation, sales development and sales teams and providing regular insights and recommendations.

apply data cleansing techniques to improve the quality and accuracy of contact and account databases.
standardize and maintain quality of multi-directional exchange of information across crm, marketing automation, erp and other applicable systems.

97.title: Data Governance Analyst
97.company name: University of California San Francisco Medical Center
97.posting:
as a preeminent health sciences campus and health system, the university of california, san francisco (ucsf) is at the forefront of creating new knowledge from the exploding volume of clinical, discovery, and education data that it creates and manages. ucsf believes that the ability to leverage these data assets is an important differentiator for an academic healthcare center and is critical to our drive toward precision medicine and the execution of key ucsf strategies for the clinical enterprise.
these strategies include supporting better population health by improving the quality of care and population health of the university of california health system’s 14 million patients. as part of this exciting and important endeavor, ucsf is seeking a highly qualified data governance analyst to support data governance adoption.
the data governance analyst will play a key role in ucsf’s critically important efforts to transform data into meaningful and actionable insight for clinicians, researchers, educators and administrators. the data governance analyst will report to the lead of data governance office and will assist the lead in the implementation of near- and long-term business strategies for standing up and operating a ucsf-wide data governance program that fits within ucsf’s mission and culture.
the data governance analyst will support in operationalizing the data governance mission, vision and charter that outlines the program’s objectives, guiding principles, and roles and responsibilities.
the data governance analyst will support the data governance program by:
supporting the daily operations of the data governance council including monitoring progress, tracking action items, measuring key accomplishments, and support or implement actions to resolve barriers or key issues
supporting the data governance adoption and achievement of program objectives
operationalizing the data governance policies and procedures
monitoring and assisting business/technical data stewards in complying with data governance policies and procedures
maintaining/updating/refreshing data governance procedures and standards
supporting the design, business analysis and user testing for collibra implementation
involves the development and implementation of the organization's data and analytics governance. works closely with across the enterprise data champions to implement and adopt data policies and processes. coordinates collibra data governance solution implementation by documenting requirements and validating use cases. as a part of data governance office, works closely with it and business partners to build and monitor data governance standards.

five to seven years applicable clinical informatics experience in a healthcare setting, or related combination of education, training, and experience

a million people a year die in car collisions around the world. that number can be zero. you can help us build an insurtech company that uses the latest technology, data science, and behavior modification methods to save lives by preventing car collisions before they happen.
